question:
Continent: North America
Location: US-Canada border
Notes: Beluga whales, important shipping route

Continent: North America
Location: New York
Notes: Connected to the Erie Canal causing NYC's rise

Continent: North America
Location: Northeastern and Mid-Atlantic US
Notes: Drains into Chesapeake Bay, longest without commercial boat traffic

Continent: North America
Location: Mid-Atlantic US
Notes: Capital of the US sits on its banks, drains into Chesapeake Bay

Continent: North America
Location: Minnesota to Gulf of Mexico
Notes: Tributaries include Ohio, Missouri, and Platte Rivers

Continent: North America
Location: Southwestern US and Mexico
Notes: Includes Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam

Continent: North America
Location: Northwestern US and Canada
Notes: 14 hydroelectric dams produce more power than any other North American river

Continent: North America
Location: Western Canada
Notes: Boreal forest, tundra, flows from Great Slave Lake into the Artic Ocean

Continent: North America
Location: Central Canada
Notes: Flows out of Lake Winnipeg, fed by Saskatchewan and Red River

Continent: North America
Location: Atlantic Coast of the US
Notes: Rises in Catskill Mountains, George Washington crossed it during the Revolutionary War

Continent: North America
Location: US-Mexico border
Notes: Dams have left only 20% of natural discharge flowing to the Gulf of Mexico

Continent: South America
Location: Brazil, Peru, Bolivia
Notes: Flows into Atlantic Ocean, second largest worldwide

Continent: South America
Location: Brazil, Argentina, Paraguay
Notes: Estuary fed by Parana and Uruguary Rivers, basin contains more of South America's population than the Amazon

Continent: Europe
Location: France
Notes: City of Lyon sits of confluence of this river and the Saone, canal system connects it to the Rhine

Continent: Europe
Location: France
Notes: Paris built along it - famous distict known as left bank, English Channel to Le Havre

Continent: Europe
Location: England
Notes: Westminster, the Globe Theatre, and St. Paul's Cathedral sit on its banks

Continent: Europe
Location: Switzerland, Austria, Germany, France, Netherlands
Notes: Transportation artery for Germany and some surrounding countries

Continent: Europe
Location: Germany to Romania
Notes: Linked to Rhine by a canal, Cities along it - Vienna, Budapest, Belgrade

Continent: Africa
Location: Egypt
Notes: Largest river worldwide, floodplains have nourished numerous empires through the ages

Continent: Africa
Location: Sub-Saharan Africa
Notes: African Great Lakes (Kivu and Tanganyika) drain to it

Continent: Africa
Location: West Africa
Notes: Cities along it - Timbuktu, Gao were important centers in the historic Trans-Saharan trade between West Africa and the Mediterranean

Continent: Asia
Location: Middle East
Notes: Two rivers, harbored some of the earliest civilizations along with the Nile and Indus, Mesopotamia means 'between the rivers'

Continent: Europe/Asia
Location: Russia
Notes: West of the Urals, 'national river of Russia', caviar comes from its delta in the Caspian Sea

Continent: Asia
Location: Middle East, India, China
Notes: Supported a notable early civilization like the Tigris, Euphrates, and Nile Rivers

Continent: Asia
Location: Bangladesh, India
Notes: Country of Bangladesh is the delta of a large river system including this river and the Brahmaputra

Continent: Asia
Location: Myanmar (Burma)
Notes: Flows primarily through Myanmar and India into the Andaman Sea

Continent: Asia
Location: Southeast Asia
Notes: Starts in China and flows through 6 Southeast Asian countries

Continent: Asia
Location: Southern China
Notes: Longest global river entirely within one country, drain 1/5 of China's land area and is home to 1/3 of its population, Three-Gorges Dam

Continent: Asia
Location: Northern China
Notes: Also knows as the Huang He, much drier than Yangtze, politically powerful north relies on southern agricultural resources

Continent: Oceania
Location: Australia - South Australia/New South Wales
Notes: Forms river system with the Darling, important agricultural region in a country with scarce water resources, trading system established to manage water right

Continent: Oceania
Location: Australia - New South Wales/Queensland
Notes: Forms river system with the Murray, important agricultural region in a country with scarce water resources, trading system established to manage water right
